get.summary: Adds a message to the chat log.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The chat message.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Changes the password of an existing user. You can only change your own password unless you have admin privileges.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The name of the user which should change its password.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The new password of the new user, either in clear text of hex-encoded.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Creates or updates a bookmark.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the media file to bookmark. If a bookmark already exists for this file it will be overwritten.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position (in milliseconds) within the media file.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Adds a new internet radio station.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Creates (or updates) a playlist.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Adds a new Podcast channel.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the Subsonic server.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a song, album or video to share. Use one id parameter for each entry to share.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Creates a new user.

parameters.name: adminRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is administrator.

parameters.name: commentRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and edit comments and ratings.

parameters.name: coverArtRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change cover art and tags.

parameters.name: downloadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to download files.

parameters.name: jukeboxRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files in jukebox mode.

parameters.name: ldapAuthenticated
parameters.description: Whether the user is authenicated in LDAP.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: The maximum bit rate (in Kbps) for the user. Audio streams of higher bit rates are automatically downsampled to this bit rate. Legal values: 0 (no limit), 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 160, 192, 224, 256, 320.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.12.0) IDs of the music folders the user is allowed access to. Include the parameter once for each folder.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the new user, either in clear text of hex-encoded.

parameters.name: playlistRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and delete playlists. Since 1.8.0, changing this role has no effect.

parameters.name: podcastRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to administrate Podcasts.

parameters.name: settingsRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change personal settings and password.

parameters.name: shareRole
parameters.description: (Since 1.8.0) Whether the user is allowed to share files with anyone.

parameters.name: streamRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files.

parameters.name: uploadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to upload files.

parameters.name: videoConversionRole
parameters.description: (Since 1.15.0) Whether the user is allowed to start video conversions.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Deletes a bookmark.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the media file for which to delete the bookmark. Other users’ bookmarks are not affected.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Deletes an existing internet radio station.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Deletes a saved playlist.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Deletes an existing user.

get.summary: Returns details for an album.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

played.description: Date the album was last played. [ISO 8601]

releaseTypes.description: The types of this album release. (Album, Compilation, EP, Remix)

userRating.description: The user rating of the album. [1-5]

transcodedContentType.description: The transcoded mediaType if transcoding should happen

transcodedSuffix.description: The file suffix of the transcoded media

subRole.description: The subRole for roles that may require it. Ex: The instrument for the performer role (TMCL/performer tags). Note: For consistency between different tag formats, the TIPL sub roles should be directly exposed in the role field.

albumGain.description: The album replay gain value. (In Db)

albumPeak.description: The album peak value. (Must be positive)

baseGain.description: The base gain value. (In Db) (Ogg Opus Output Gain for example)

fallbackGain.description: An optional fallback gain that clients should apply when the corresponding gain value is missing. (Can be computed from the tracks or exposed as an user setting.)

trackGain.description: The track replay gain value. (In Db)

trackPeak.description: The track peak value. (Must be positive)

get.summary: Searches for and returns lyrics for a given song.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Retrieves all structured lyrics from the server for a given song.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

displayArtist.description: The artist name to display. This could be the localized name, or any other value

displayTitle.description: The title to display. This could be the song title (localized), or any other value

lang.description: The lyrics language (ideally ISO 639). If the language is unknown (e.g. lrc file), the server must return und (ISO standard) or xxx

start.description: The start time of the lyrics, relative to the start time of the track, in milliseconds. If this is not part of synced lyrics, start must be omitted

value.description: The actual text of this line

line.description: The actual lyrics. Ordered by start time (synced) or appearance order

offset.description: The offset to apply to all lyrics, in milliseconds. Positive means lyrics appear sooner, negative means later. If not included, the offset must be assumed to be 0

synced.description: True if the lyrics are synced, false otherwise

structuredLyrics.description: Structured lyrics. There can be multiple lyrics of the same type with the same language

get.summary: Downloads a given media file.
Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the server’s audio hardware.

parameters.name: gain
parameters.description: Used by setGain to control the playback volume. A float value between 0.0 and 1.0.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Used by add and set. ID of song to add to the jukebox playlist. Use multiple id parameters to add many songs in the same request. (set is similar to a clear followed by a add, but will not change the currently playing track.)

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Used by skip and remove. Zero-based index of the song to skip to or remove.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used by skip. Start playing this many seconds into the track.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

currentIndex.description: The current index of the song being played

transcodedContentType.description: The transcoded mediaType if transcoding should happen

transcodedSuffix.description: The file suffix of the transcoded media

playing.description: Whether the queue is currently playing

position.description: The current position of the track in seconds

get.summary: Ping Subsonic server to keep the connection alive.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Requests the server to check for new Podcast episodes.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Saves the state of the play queue for this user.

parameters.name: current
parameters.description: The ID of the current playing song.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position (in milliseconds) within the media file.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Registers the local playback of one or more media files.

parameters.name: submission
parameters.description: True for playback completed, false for in-progress

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) at which the song was listened to.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Returns albums, artists and songs matching the given search criteria. Supports paging through the result.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

transcodedContentType.description: The transcoded mediaType if transcoding should happen

transcodedSuffix.description: The file suffix of the transcoded media

subRole.description: The subRole for roles that may require it. Ex: The instrument for the performer role (TMCL/performer tags). Note: For consistency between different tag formats, the TIPL sub roles should be directly exposed in the role field.

albumGain.description: The album replay gain value. (In Db)

albumPeak.description: The album peak value. (Must be positive)

baseGain.description: The base gain value. (In Db) (Ogg Opus Output Gain for example)

fallbackGain.description: An optional fallback gain that clients should apply when the corresponding gain value is missing. (Can be computed from the tracks or exposed as an user setting.)

trackGain.description: The track replay gain value. (In Db)

trackPeak.description: The track peak value. (Must be positive)

played.description: Date the album was last played. [ISO 8601]

releaseTypes.description: The types of this album release. (Album, Compilation, EP, Remix)

userRating.description: The user rating of the album. [1-5]

transcodedSuffix.description: The file suffix of the transcoded media

get.summary: Sets the rating for an item.

parameters.name: rating
parameters.description: The rating from 0 to 5

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Attaches a star to a song, album or artist.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Initiates a rescan of the media libraries.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Streams a given media file.

parameters.name: converted
parameters.description: Only applicable to video streaming. Subsonic can optimize videos for streaming by converting them to MP4. If a conversion exists for the video in question, then setting this parameter to "true" will cause the converted video to be returned instead of the original.

parameters.name: estimateContentLength
parameters.description: If set to "true", the Content-Length HTTP header will be set to an estimated value for transcoded or downsampled media.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specifies the preferred target format (e.g., "mp3" or "flv") in case there are multiple applicable transcodings. Starting with 1.9.0 you can use the special value "raw" to disable transcoding.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Only applicable to video streaming. Requested video size specified as WxH, for instance "640x480".

parameters.name: timeOffset
parameters.description: [OS] Only applicable to video streaming. If specified, start streaming at the given offset (in seconds) into the video. Typically used to implement video skipping.

get.summary: Returns information about an API key.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Attaches a star to a song, album or artist.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Updates an existing internet radio station.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Updates a playlist. Only the owner of a playlist is allowed to update it.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Updates the description and/or expiration date for an existing share.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the share to update.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

get.summary: Updates user properties. Only the owner of a user is allowed to update it.

parameters.name: adminRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is administrator.

parameters.name: commentRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and edit comments and ratings.

parameters.name: coverArtRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change cover art and tags.

parameters.name: downloadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to download files.

parameters.name: jukeboxRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files in jukebox mode.

parameters.name: ldapAuthenticated
parameters.description: Whether the user is authenicated in LDAP.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: The maximum bit rate (in Kbps) for the user. Audio streams of higher bit rates are automatically downsampled to this bit rate. Legal values: 0 (no limit), 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 160, 192, 224, 256, 320.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.12.0) IDs of the music folders the user is allowed access to. Include the parameter once for each folder.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the user, either in clear text of hex-encoded.

parameters.name: playlistRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and delete playlists. Since 1.8.0, changing this role has no effect.

parameters.name: podcastRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to administrate Podcasts.

parameters.name: settingsRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change personal settings and password.

parameters.name: shareRole
parameters.description: (Since 1.8.0) Whether the user is allowed to share files with anyone.

parameters.name: streamRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files.

parameters.name: uploadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to upload files.

parameters.name: videoConversionRole
parameters.description: (Since 1.15.0) Whether the user is allowed to start video conversions.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

ApiKey.description: [OS] An API key used for authentication.
ApiKey.name: apiKey

ApiVersion.description: The protocol version implemented by the client.
ApiVersion.name: v

ClientName.description: A unique string identifying the client application.
ClientName.name: c

Password.description: The password, either in clear text or hex-encoded with a “enc:” prefix.
Password.name: p

ResponseFormat.description: Request data to be returned in this format. Supported values are “xml”, “json” (since 1.4.0) and “jsonp” (since 1.6.0). If using jsonp, specify name of javascript callback function using a callback parameter.
ResponseFormat.name: f

Salt.description: A random string (“salt”) used as input for computing the password hash.
Salt.name: s

Token.description: The authentication token computed as md5(password + salt).
Token.name: t
